inventory: Paris, Bibl. Nationale, Suppl. gr. 1099 folio IV
greektext:
base edition: Les papyrus grecs d’Achmîm à la bibliothèque nationale de Paris , Cairo, 1930 (P. Collart)
other edition: ed.pr.

Greek text in Unicode
author: anon.
contents:
hypothesis to Iliad 1, (with indication of book-number [letter alpha] and citation of first line), followed by a glossary to Il. 1.1-21.
The hypothesis is completely different from the one preserved in medieval manuscripts, but almost identical with that of P.Oxy. 56, 3829.
propernames:
hypothesis: Pêlêiadês (Q); Achilleus (Q + 3); Agamemnôn (2); Apollôn; Chrysês; Chrysêis (2); Hellênes [Greeks] (2); Kalchas (2); Brisêis; Thetis; Zeus; Aithiopia [Ethiopia]; Hêra; Hêphaistos;
glossary: Olympos (Q + 2); Makedonia.
mythological:
hypothesis: Pêlêiadês (Q); Achilleus (Q + 3); Agamemnôn (2); Apollôn; Chrysês; Chrysêis (2); Hellênes [Greeks] (2); Kalchas (2); Brisêis; Thetis; Zeus; Aithiopia [Ethiopia]; Hêra; Hêphaistos;
glossary: Olympos (Q + 2); Makedonia.
statepreservation:
36 complete lines (broken off at the left by 2-3 letters in l. 22-33), from a column a full height;
l. 1-19 = hypothesis; l. 20-36 = glossary.
lectionalsigns: trema (several); several high stops; one apostrophe; double dots to separate lemmata and scholia in the glossary; abbreviation of Theos as if nomen sacrum; line-filler (in the form of a long forked paragraphos) at the end of l. 20; forked paragraphos between l. 20-21 in order to separate hypothesis from glossary; iota adscript occasionally written; some misspellings.
hand: small, informal, round, upright, fluent but somewhat irregular and not strictly bilinear, with occasional hooks and some cursive elements.
